action.text: Heath Maguire assigned to Heath Maguire

full_threads.body: @heath @rica please it now https://metrorehab2021.wpperk.cloud/

action.text: Rica Rosario Valencia assigned to Manuel Lito Manceli

full_threads.body: @manuel can I ask you to work on these please? Thank you!

Hi Heath,

We’ve reviewed the first draft of the website and loving it so far – such an improvement from what it was!

A few things we’d like to change.

Homepage:
Remove DONATE call out and include I heart NDIS logo instead (please let me know if you do not have this)
Remove “I AM LOOKING FOR” green section
Change banner to direct to Neurological Programs and title “Experts in Neurological Rehabilitation”, make banner more narrow
Change the boxes below to Sydney Stroke Rehab Centre, Cancer programs, Parkinsons programs, Orthopaedic and musculoskeletal programs, Reconditioning and pain management programs, Cardiac rehabilitation programs


Move up the above boxes above the block of text but under the below heading “Stroke Recovery, Parkinson's Treatment, Brain Injury, Neurological & Cancer Rehabilitation Services in Sydney” and change heading to “Conditions we treat”
Remove COVID message banner
Include CTA buttons for Day Rehab and Inpatient Services that include phone numbers and links to below landing pages:
Inpatient Rehab: https://metrorehab2021.wpperk.cloud/patient-services-at-metro-rehab/patient-programs/inpatient-rehabilitation-programs/ <https://metrorehab2021.wpperk.cloud/patient-services-at-metro-rehab/patient-programs/inpatient-rehabilitation-programs/>
Day Rehab: https://metrorehab2021.wpperk.cloud/patient-services-at-metro-rehab/patient-programs/day-programs/ <https://metrorehab2021.wpperk.cloud/patient-services-at-metro-rehab/patient-programs/day-programs/>
Update the NDIS Services page to the last landing page we were working on: https://www.metrorehab.com.au/ndis-therapy-supports/ <https://www.metrorehab.com.au/ndis-therapy-supports/>


Patient Services drop down:


Please remove Information for Patients, Day Rehabilitation programs and Overview.

Can we update this drop down menu to be

For patients:
Conditions we treat: Sydney Stroke Rehab Centre, Cancer programs, Parkinsons programs, Orthopaedic and musculoskeletal programs, Reconditioning and pain management programs, Cardiac rehabilitation programs
General Information (pulled from main drop down menu) – Fees and Charges https://metrorehab2021.wpperk.cloud/patient-services-at-metro-rehab/information-for-patients/fees-and-charges-2/ <https://metrorehab2021.wpperk.cloud/patient-services-at-metro-rehab/information-for-patients/fees-and-charges-2/>, Privacy Policy, FAQs, Helpful Links
Facilities (pulled from main drop down menu) – Accommodation, Catering, Patient Facilities and Services, Activities
For Visitors: https://metrorehab2021.wpperk.cloud/general-info/visitor-information/ <https://metrorehab2021.wpperk.cloud/general-info/visitor-information/>

Please note, we would like you and Brittany’s thoughts on this as understand this is a drastic change. What are your thoughts? Will this change in drop down menu affect SEO @Brittany <mailto:brittany@practiceedge.com.au>?

Overall:
Whole website is slightly wider than RR please keep this consistent
Bottom grey section: Can we please mimick the RR grey section? Please keep Proudly owned by RR, add a Contact Us Today and Subscribe to our Newsletter (for Rehab Matters) and keep teaching affiliates


Condition pages:
We love seeing the many disciplines at the bottom. But instead of Patient Programs as heading can we please say “Benefit from our team of health professionals”



Any questions let me know! Would love to hear your thoughts on our changes as well.

Thanks so much,
Janina


JANINA HIPOLITO​

I wish to pay my respects to the traditional custodians and all Aboriginal community elders and people, past and present on whose lands I live and work.

From: Heath Maguire <heath@wolfiq.com.au <mailto:heath@wolfiq.com.au>>
Sent: Thursday, 29 July 2021 10:26 AM
To: Janina Hipolito <Janina.Hipolito@Royalrehab.com.au <mailto:Janina.Hipolito@Royalrehab.com.au>>
Cc: Trudy McEnearney <Trudy.McEnearney@Royalrehab.com.au <mailto:Trudy.McEnearney@Royalrehab.com.au>>
Subject: Re: MR website build

Hi Janina,

Apologies on the my delay in getting this to you.

Great news the site is now ready for you to see in draft stage:
https://metrorehab2021.wpperk.cloud/ <https://metrorehab2021.wpperk.cloud/>

I have recorded a quick video run through:
https://www.loom.com/share/77f870bf1b1f42a5b387b560a9725d9a <https://www.loom.com/share/77f870bf1b1f42a5b387b560a9725d9a>

Janina, you should receive an email to setup your login shortly as well.

Next steps:

We have some polishing to do and will add some visual interest to some pages. The big first task was to bring everything over and now we will refine, particularly the header and footer. But for the most part, the site is there and functional and fast!

We will also start to make suggestions for the navigation working in conjunction with Brittany (PE).

This next phase will take 1 week.

If you have any questions let me know,

Thanks and speak soon,
Heath Maguire
CREATIVE DIRECTOR

Phone: 1300 072 134 <tel:1300%20072%20134>
Mobile: 0415 162 271 <tel:0415%20162%20271>
Email: heath@wolfiq.com.au <mailto:heath@wolfiq.com.au>
<https://wolfiq.com.au/>

Janina
